nicknames.SB229: Cell Phone Lockable Bag Pilot Program
nicknames.SB22: Protection of Minors on Social Media
nicknames.HB1430: Protection of Minors on Social Media (House companion)
nicknames.HB1513: Liability for Material Harmful to Minors
nicknames.SB631: Parental Consent for School Virtual Mental Health

descriptions.SB1014: Requires all PA public schools to adopt bell-to-bell phone-free policies, storing devices in lockers or pouches during school hours.
descriptions.HB1814: Prohibits students from using cell phones during instructional time in public schools.
descriptions.SB229: Creates a pilot program for schools to provide lockable phone storage pouches (like Yondr).
descriptions.SB22: Prohibits social media platforms from allowing minors under 16 to create accounts without parental consent. Bans targeted advertising to minors.
descriptions.HB1430: House companion to SB22. Requires parental consent for minors on social media and bans targeted ads to kids.
descriptions.HB2215: Requires age verification for websites hosting content harmful to minors and creates online safety standards.
descriptions.HB1729: Establishes comprehensive online safety protections for children including platform duty of care.
descriptions.SB603: Requires internet platforms to verify age and restrict minors' access to harmful content.
descriptions.HB1513: Creates liability for platforms that knowingly distribute material harmful to minors.
descriptions.SB378: Establishes student data privacy protections â€” limits how ed-tech companies can collect, use, and share student data.
descriptions.HB811: Creates civil liability for using AI-generated deepfakes to misrepresent someone, including protections for minors.
descriptions.HB1098: Funds a dedicated unit to investigate and prosecute internet crimes against children (ICAC).
descriptions.HB2217: Requires public schools to provide minimum daily recess and adequate lunch periods for all students.
descriptions.HB1669: Mandates daily unstructured free-play recess for elementary students in public schools.
descriptions.HB1873: Reforms child endangerment laws so parents aren't penalized for allowing age-appropriate independence (free-range parenting).
descriptions.HB939: Extends child labor protections to minors working as social media content creators, including earnings protections.
descriptions.SB112: Comprehensive consumer data privacy law with requirements for how companies handle personal data, including children's data.
descriptions.HB78: House companion to SB112. Consumer data privacy protections including children's data provisions.
descriptions.SB631: Requires schools to obtain parental consent before providing virtual/telehealth mental health services to students.
descriptions.SB293: Requires a study on the impact of artificial intelligence on PA's workforce and schools.
